frontmatter.title: The principle of declarative desired state
frontmatter.description: A system managed by GitOps must have its Desired State expressed declaratively as data in a format writable and readable by both humans and machines.

frontmatter.title: The principle of immutable desired state versions
frontmatter.description: Desired State is stored in a way that supports versioning, immutability of versions, and retains a complete version history.

frontmatter.title: The principle of continuous state reconciliation
frontmatter.description: Software agents continuously, and automatically, compare a system's Actual State to its Desired State. If the actual and desired states differ for any reason, automated actions to reconcile them are initiated.

frontmatter.title: The principle of operations through declaration
frontmatter.description: The only mechanism through which the system is intentionally operated on is through these principles.
